description: Compact code representing the work order's current state. Joins to the status description and drives workflow, reporting, and business rules.
Human-readable label for the status code, used in screens and reports to explain the work order's stage.
Indicates the status is retired and should not be assigned to new work orders, but remains for historical reference.
System-generated unique identifier for this status record; used as the primary key and for foreign key references.
Flags that a work order in this status counts the asset as out of service for availability and downtime calculations.
Controls whether entering this status triggers email notifications to stakeholders per configured rules.
When set, moving into this status clears the work order's Date Out/return-to-service timestamp (likely; confirm with SME).
